channel.title: Call of duty black ops Or medal of honor?
channel.description:
What are you planning to buy? saw tons of reviews . I got all old call of duty's (mwf's) AND medal of honor games. Idk both look very good...
Thanks

item.description:
@whip_of_soulz wrote:

Frell:

Medal of Honor is the most horrible fucking game ever created. The campaign is good, rent it. THE ONLINE MULTIPLAYER IS HORRIBLE. Its only playable for 3 days and theres only 3 unlockable guns. They had something really good going to, had they put more time into it it would have been better.

I’m surprised you didn’t mention camping.

item.source: Call of duty black ops Or medal of honor?

item.title: Call of duty black ops Or medal of honor?
item.dc:creator: @whip_of_soulz whip of soulz
item.description:
@whip_of_soulz wrote:

[quote=“reverce, post:37, topic:365608”][quote author=whip of soulz link=topic=461811.msg3380695#msg3380695 date=1288001654]

Basically Call of Duty will always be the most popular out of the two.

The game is well known and every single one of their releases are highly exciting.

The new Medal of Honor has awesome physics and is very realistic, game-play the whole nine-yards it’s a very refreshing feeling if you’re not used to major realism in video games.

Call of Duty Modern Warfare 2 really disappointed the PC crowd, there were no Dedicated servers which is one of the best features of playing on the PC. PC gamers were left the a replica of the console game, besides controls etc, Infinity Ward really let the PC gamers down. But Treyarch is determined not to do so.

I currently have the new Medal of Honor and I plan on getting Blackops as it will have dedicated servers, and I’m a dedicated fan of the COD series.

Overall they are completely different games, if you want to be more tactical with your multiplayer game-play then go for Medal of Honor, if you have enjoyed previous versions of Call of Duty then go with Blackops, I assure you they are both going to be amazing.
[/quote]The realism is what lets medal of honour down.

I think realism is good .[/quote]Medal of honour is like a game where mw2 and battlefield got squashed together and then shit on by dog.

Read full topic
item.source: Call of duty black ops Or medal of honor?

I currently have the new Medal of Honor and I plan on getting Blackops as it will have dedicated servers, and I’m a dedicated fan of the COD series.

Overall they are completely different games, if you want to be more tactical with your multiplayer game-play then go for Medal of Honor, if you have enjoyed previous versions of Call of Duty then go with Blackops, I assure you they are both going to be amazing.
[/quote]The realism is what lets medal of honour down.

I think realism is good .[/quote]

item.source: Call of duty black ops Or medal of honor?

item.title: Call of duty black ops Or medal of honor?
item.dc:creator: @all_day All Day
item.description:
@all_day wrote:

Basically Call of Duty will always be the most popular out of the two.

The game is well known and every single one of their releases are highly exciting.

The new Medal of Honor has awesome physics and is very realistic, game-play the whole nine-yards it’s a very refreshing feeling if you’re not used to major realism in video games.

Call of Duty Modern Warfare 2 really disappointed the PC crowd, there were no Dedicated servers which is one of the best features of playing on the PC. PC gamers were left the a replica of the console game, besides controls etc, Infinity Ward really let the PC gamers down. But Treyarch is determined not to do so.

I currently have the new Medal of Honor and I plan on getting Blackops as it will have dedicated servers, and I’m a dedicated fan of the COD series.

Overall they are completely different games, if you want to be more tactical with your multiplayer game-play then go for Medal of Honor, if you have enjoyed previous versions of Call of Duty then go with Blackops, I assure you they are both going to be amazing.

Read full topic
